title: Word of mouth makes 'Talvar' a game-changer: 70% weekday occupancy, housefull weekends
text:
As they get into what they expect to be another packed weekend, exhibitors say Talvar has rewritten movie viewing patterns across the country
Not just metros, not just evening shows, but tier-2 cities and afternoon shows too.
It is doing extremely well in all the top 20 cities: PVR
" The collections on Monday and Tuesday were better than Saturday and we added more screens for the weekdays. It is doing extremely well in all the top 20 cities and we had to increase the number of shows not just in Delhi and Mumbai but all our centres."
— Kamal Gianchandani, CEO, PVR Pictures
READ: President Pranab Mukherjee to watch ' Talvar '
Weekend occupancy was 95% and we had to increase screens on weekdays: Cinepolis
" The 60-70% occupancy in afternoon shows and housefull shows at night on weekdays was quite surprising. And it is a pan-India phenomenon. Even in cities like Patna, we had to increase the number of shows."
— Devang Sampat, business head, strategy, Cinepolis
Talvar is doing quite well not only in metros, but also in tier-2 cities: bookmyshow
" The shows were housefull this week in Mumbai and Pune. Many multiplex chains added more shows from Monday even in cities like Lucknow and Bhubaneswar."
— A representative of BookMyShow
Listen to songs of Talvar on Gaana.com
"Shows are almost housefull in the evening, while in the afternoon, the occupancy is around 60%: SRS Cinemas The occupancy rate is this high not only in the metros, but also in cities in Punjab and UP, including Kanpur, Bareilly and Lucknow, and we have been selling advance tickets."
— Tinku Singh, vice president and chief strategy officer, SRS cinemas
